provides.name: vcs
provides.description: commands for working with version control systems

provides.name: vcs clone
provides.description: Checkout/clone a repository into a Bespin project

provides.name: vcs log
provides.description: Display the changes to the current file.

provides.name: vcs update
provides.description: Update your working copy from the remote repository

provides.name: vcs status
provides.description: Display the status of the repository files.
provides.manual:
Shows the current state of the files in the repository
M for modified, ? for unknown (you may need to add), R for removed, ! for files that are deleted but not removed

provides.name: vcs diff
provides.description: Display the differences in the checkout out files

params.name: files
params.description: Use the current file, add -a for all files or add filenames

provides.manual: Without any options, the vcs diff command will diff the currently selected file against the repository copy. If you pass in -a, the command will diff all files. Finally, you can list files to diff individually.

provides.name: vcs add
provides.description: Adds missing files to the project

params.name: files
params.description: Use the current file, add -a for all files or add filenames

provides.manual: Without any options, the vcs add command will add the currently selected file. If you pass in -a, the command will add all files. Finally, you can list files individually.

provides.name: vcs revert
provides.description: Revert files back to their checked-in state

params.name: files
params.description: Use the current file, add -a for all files or add filenames

provides.manual: Without any options, the vcs revert command will revert the currently selected file against the repository copy. If you pass in -a, the command will revert all files. Finally, you can list files to revert individually. No backups are kept!

provides.name: vcs remove
provides.description: Remove a file from version control (also deletes it)
provides.manual: The files presented will be deleted and removed from version control.

provides.name: vcs resolved

params.name: files
params.description: Use the current file, add -a for all files or add filenames

provides.manual: Without any options, the vcs resolved command will mark the currently selected file as resolved. If you pass in -a, the command will resolve all files. Finally, you can list files individually.

provides.name: hg init
provides.manual: This will create a new repository in this project.
